episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about the abundance of scientific papers on dung beetles compared to human extinction, Finnish doctors receiving swords upon graduation, the role of a samurai in starting California's wine industry, and donkeys carrying lambs in their pockets. The hosts explore these topics with humor and delve into related anecdotes and historical contexts.

facts.fact: There are more scientific papers on dung beetles than there are on preventing the extinction of mankind.
New Finnish doctors are officially issued with a sword.
California's international wine industry was started by a samurai.
Some donkeys keep sheep in their pockets.
